main_definition: Elder is a term used to refer to an older person, often with respect and authority due to their age, or it can also indicate something that has been around longer than others.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An older person in the family
meanings_and_examples.example: My grandfather is an elder who provides guidance and wisdom based on his many years of experience.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A respected senior member of a community or group due to age
meanings_and_examples.example: The tribal council includes several elders who are consulted for their advice and opinions.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Something that has existed longer than others, indicating its endurance or longevity
meanings_and_examples.example: The ancient castle is an elder structure compared to the modern buildings surrounding it.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A title given to a person of high social rank in certain cultures
meanings_and_examples.example: In some royal families, individuals who are older and hold significant power may be referred to as elders.
